com.bq.robotic.droid2ino.communication.btsocket

Class BtSocketConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bq.robotic.droid2ino.communication.btsocket.BtSocketConnection

  • public class BtSocketConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class does all the work for setting up and managing Bluetooth connections with other devices. It has a thread that listens for incoming connections, a thread for connecting with a device, and a thread for performing data transmissions when connected.

    based on http://developer.android.com/resources/samples/BluetoothChat/index.html

        Return the current connection state.

      • isDuplexConnection

        public boolean isDuplexConnection()
        When the connection is only for sending from the mobile device, not in both directions, the thread mustn't be listening to the inputStream. Returns whether this connection is full duplex or not
        Returns:

      • setDuplexConnection

        public void setDuplexConnection(boolean isDuplexConnection)
        Set if this connection to full duplex or not
        Parameters:
        isDuplexConnection - is full duplex or not

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the connectivity service. Specifically start AcceptThread to begin a session in listening (server) mode. Called by the Activity onResume()

      • connect

        public void connect(BluetoothDevice device)
        Start the ConnectThread to initiate a connection to a remote device.
        Parameters:
        device - The BluetoothDevice to connect

      • connected

        public void connected(BluetoothSocket socket,
                      BluetoothDevice device)
        Start the ConnectedThread to begin managing a Bluetooth connection
        Parameters:
        socket - The BluetoothSocket on which the connection was made
        device - The BluetoothDevice that has been connected
